title: Miss Fortune... time to get real!
body:
Time to get serious about {{champion:21}} ... since I just saw that she's getting a visual update sooner or later on Riot's update website list 
_thingy_. 

I've only played League of Legends for about a year and a half now. Yes, I know that I'm a Team Builder player, which means I _rarely_ play ranked, but I still have a right to say something too, _right_?  

I used to main her back in the day when one would say, "_noob_" or even "_beginner_". I used to play her through levels 14-27. Then I got really excited with {{champion:222}}, which means; bye bye {{champion:21}}! 

I would love to main her again, I obviously can, but there are some serious things that she should possibly have in order to make her... "_meta_", as someone said to me when I played her in normals, (also got flamed a **TON** for playing her)! 


____________________________________

_**BEFORE you start reading this, I want you to know that I don't expect ALL these changes. That could make her overpowered... but I really wish there could be changes to her passive and maybe even her E. **_

____________________________________


_**Passive -**_ I really want to know the reason why **ANY** damage cancels her movement speed boost. I'm fine when enemy champions hit me and cancel it, that's reasonable. But why make it where enemy minions, or even neutral monsters, cancel it? 

I can't even **count** how much times I have lost a kill or even died from minions hitting me, making my passive go **BOOM**! For a champion with no dash or escape, as someone would call it, I would expect this wouldn't be part of her  kit. This is like giving {{champion:17}}'s W, {{champion:15}}'s passive , or even {{champion:222}}'es passive going bye bye from any **MINION** or neutral monster damage. 

I remember reading her "_nerf history_" , how before having a shield on her wouldn't cancel the movement speed if someone, or **SOMETHING**, attacked her. They _nerfed_ her where having a shield would actually cancel it, but this was long ago when League of Legends actually started from what I see. **If you can't at least bring the "minion's won't cancel the speed", then _pleaseeee_ consider having her passive non-cancelable if she has a shield on her. **

If she had the {{champion:86}} passive change it would be perfect! 

*I did find something really cool-looking a short while ago which someone suggested on doing something where every time she puts a level on her ultimate she could get benefits on how many HITS it takes to cancel the passive over a certain amount of ??? time ;

Level 1 - 1 hit 
 Level 6 - 2 hits
  Level 11 - 3 hits
   Level 16 - 4 hits

(_enemy champions cancel and 11+ neutral monsters will cancel as well_)

_**Q - **_ This skill is fine to me. The damage is actually really good if you get the 2nd bounce, especially in lane. The mana cost is great too. 

This spell is very _unique_ to me, and I still don't know why. :)

_**W -**_ The grievous wounds are **PERFECT**... if they have a _sustain_ comp or the enemy needs a lot of healing. This skill is actually O.K. if you use your ultimate, since it will increase the stacks of magic damage done to the enemy, or even auto the _hell_ out of the enemy. 

Instead of 2 seconds for the grievous wounds, 2.5 or even 3 would be cool to see. Another thing that could happen is actually let it scale with the amount of levels you put into it for the duration ; 

**_Example_** ; 2/2.25/2.50/2.75/3 seconds

_**E - **_ They did buff the slow % long ago, it's just the minor damage that bothers me. 

_**Logically speaking**_ - Why not make her have some **AD** ratio, since_ they're_ bullets anyway. 

I find this ability **COMPLETELY** useless. The damage can't even put a beat down on minions unless you go AP. The slow is a little _dissatisfying_, and sometimes I feel the cast range of pressing this button is bull!@#$. An AD ratio would help with the damage _problem_ a little, and if you can't do that then having it do something with the grievous wounds W would be **great**. 

Now the big problem is **on how she casts it**. I sometimes feel like it's not even worth it to press 'E' and then have this horrible animation taking place.

If this ability was ever completely removed from her kit, I don't think I would even land a {{item:3070}}.  

_**R - **_ The only thing that **really **hurt {{champion:21}} was removing the **AD ratio** off of this. 

"_She's a early game champion, we removed this because she isn't a late game champion and blah blah blah_". The thing is, ADC's are late game carries that are monsters. This ultimate is really unique since it can change the tide of battle, which some ADCs can't do. 

**This is all!!! **

**Obviously I know I can't get everything I want but I would love some buffs to be taken in place. **

replies.body: Yeah, taking the AD ratio off her ult ruined her. That was such a dumb change. Yes, it procs impure shots, but they do MAGiC damage. Building AD gives her magic damage, and building AP gives her physical damage. That's so backwards. Build black cleaver, get 40 AD and arpen, but your ult does more magic damage. Build last whisper, get arpn, increase the magic damage once again. Build void staff, deal more physical damage, get more magic pen. it makes absolutely no sense.

What are you talking about, the ult now applies W's on-hit which is the AD scaling. If anything, they actually buffed MF.

Changing the {{item:3072}} is what hit her the hardest, she is still very strong.

I think you underestimate how strong that AS boost really is and how well it scales as you get items.  Yeah, Graves dashes and gains 70% AS at max rank.  MF passively does stacking magic damage that scales with AD and gets grievous wounds / 60% AS at max rank while active.  I'd say she's not getting screwed at all, her W is quite good as it is.

Her passive just needs the Garen change.  Level 11 only large monsters and champions can cancel her passive.  It would probably be perfectly fine then.  Having it only drop on HP damage taken would be a good QoL change for her.

Hate her E and wouldn't be sad it if goes.  At the very least have it play into her W's stacking or something.

I'd just like to see her ultimate have AD scaling again..  Having it apply the stacks from her W was nice though.

Hi I'm a long time {{champion:21}} main and I want to give my own opinion on the state of Miss Fortune right now.

**Currently she's considered unviable due to the lack of mobility and her awkward playstyle. Don't get me wrong, she does plenty of damage but she's very immobile and has counterplay. But take it from this perspective, if Miss Fortune's Q, E, and Ult could be casted while moving + you couldn't break her passive, then imagine how annoying, overpowered, and strong she would be with arguably the strongest laning phase in the game.**



**Early Game: **Her early game is iconic for being hard to go up against, she has so much poke and is really good at everything in terms of laning including following up ganks, farming, zoning, and even hard countering Soraka and Sona.

**Mid Game: **Honestly, her mid game is underrated. Mid game is where you teamfight, Miss Fortune's ultimate can be game changing. She actually scales really well with items since her **auto attacks can do +48% of her bonus AD on each attack** yes this includes against Baron/Dragon too. She has great objective control due to her reliable ability to push, her ultimate can easily steal any Dragon or Baron, her dueling ability is amazing due to her AA>Q>AA combo with her W and E on top of it. There's not a whole lot to say. She does VERY well at this point
 

**Late Game: ** This is also very underrated. While she has a small fall off, her ultimate can still do a ton of damage and still can carry games due to all ADCs being strong no matter what late game. Late game is usually pushing/sieging with a few teamfights at full build/almost full build. Miss Fortune's W passive allows her to scale pretty decently into late game in comparison if she didn't have it. She falls off, true, but she still is useful in many ways.

**To sum up**

Miss Fortune is a really high damage output, due to the fact she does high MAGICAL and PHYSICAL damage on BOTH of her spells and auto attacks, it makes it very difficult to fully counterbuild her in comparison to someone like Draven, Ashe, or Caitlyn. She doesn't have a lot of fall offs aside from her being extremely immobile due to her cast times and passive being easy to break. Really, she just needs a **SMALL** buff, nothing big like +100% AD scaling on her E. This isn't what she needs.

You can compare her to {{champion:96}} if you keep them alive, they will destroy an enemy team very easily and if not, it's not much of a challenge for them to burst down the enemy carries along with dying themselves. They have great teamfighting and great dueling, but very low mobility. The only thing is that Kog'Maw usually reaches this point around late game (or mid in some cases). whereas Miss Fortune is at this point early - mid, and sort of late game depending on who she's up against and her build.

But take it from this perspective, if Miss Fortune's Q, E, and Ult could be casted while moving + you couldn't break her passive, then imagine how annoying, overpowered, and strong she would be with arguably the strongest laning phase in the game.**
>

> 
> **Early Game: **Her early game is iconic for being hard to go up against, she has so much poke and is really good at everything in terms of laning including following up ganks, farming, zoning, and even hard countering Soraka and Sona.
> 
> **Mid Game: **Honestly, her mid game is underrated. Mid game is where you teamfight, Miss Fortune's ultimate can be game changing. She actually scales really well with items since her **auto attacks can do +48% of her bonus AD on each attack** yes this includes against Baron/Dragon too. She has great objective control due to her reliable ability to push, her ultimate can easily steal any Dragon or Baron, her dueling ability is amazing due to her AA>Q>AA combo with her W and E on top of it. There's not a whole lot to say. She does VERY well at this point
>  
> 
> **Late Game: ** This is also very underrated. While she has a small fall off, her ultimate can still do a ton of damage and still can carry games due to all ADCs being strong no matter what late game. Late game is usually pushing/sieging with a few teamfights at full build/almost full build. Miss Fortune's W passive allows her to scale pretty decently into late game in comparison if she didn't have it. She falls off, true, but she still is useful in many ways.
> 
> **To sum up**
> 
> Miss Fortune is a really high damage output, due to the fact she does high MAGICAL and PHYSICAL damage on BOTH of her spells and auto attacks, it makes it very difficult to fully counterbuild her in comparison to someone like Draven, Ashe, or Caitlyn. She doesn't have a lot of fall offs aside from her being extremely immobile due to her cast times and passive being easy to break. Really, she just needs a **SMALL** buff, nothing big like +100% AD scaling on her E. This isn't what she needs.
> 
> You can compare her to {{champion:96}} if you keep them alive, they will destroy an enemy team very easily and if not, it's not much of a challenge for them to burst down the enemy carries along with dying themselves. They have great teamfighting and great dueling, but very low mobility. The only thing is that Kog'Maw usually reaches this point around late game (or mid in some cases). whereas Miss Fortune is at this point early - mid, and sort of late game depending on who she's up against and her build.

She needs more than a small buff. First, she needs a VU. Then her E needs to be looked at again, it's a pretty useless skin esp with mana costs. Her passive also is garbage for an adc. Her ult isn't that good. Q and W are okay skills. that's more than a small buff, she needs a minor rework imo.

Not really? I know Miss Fortune isn't a straightforward champion, and most people I've seen who haven't played her extensively have absolutely no clue what any of her abilities really do due to how confusing and old her kit is. Any Miss Fortune main I've seen though usually can carry games alone a lot of the time.

-Her passive isn't the best nor the worst. It allows her to roam, get into lane, dodge skillshots, and poke much more easily. It makes her have a better laning phase and while I will say it needs to be looked at, it's not the core problem to Miss Fortune.

-Her Q is a level 1 instant auto attack reset that does damage. It's definitely an amazing skill and makes Miss Fortune strong.

-Her W lets her do up to 48% of her bonus AD in auto attacks AS MAGIC DAMAGE, that's insane. It gives her Grevious Wounds which means that people like Soraka or Sona won't do anything anything. Also this entire ability makes Taric an easy matchup, since he stacks lots of armor against ADCs with his heal, you do a lot of magic damage and also have grevious wounds. The active attack speed buff isn't a lot, but Miss Fortune really doesn't need more attack speed due to her AA resets on a low cooldown.

-Her E is awkward but it's not useless. It's a slow with a pretty big range and you can use it for so many purposes. People confuse it for supposing to do damage, but that's not what it's suppose to do.

-And finally her ultimate/R. This is game changing due to how high the damage can be, it applies Grevious Wounds and stacks of MF's W passive to everyone it hits. This is also very useful, early game it can be an easy way to get a double kill, last hit fleeing enemies, win entire teamfights, get the enemies to back off. The damage is really scary if you leave her unchecked, it does scale off AD by the way.

I don't really see a legitimate point in demanding Miss Fortune a small rework. There's people who play her a lot and do perfectly fine with her, including people who play her in higher elos. She sits at a **constant** strong winrate with one of the highest pentakill averages in the game. I'm not saying these are good to go off by, but you know she is decent if she maintains these throughout all of the patches and new champions.

She's easy to play, but to make her fully effective you need to be quite experienced in playing her and you will end up doing better than most other ADCs at this time. Remember that she also counters most ADCs including flat out overpowered ones like Kalista.

I'll try to argue your points. Her passive is basically let me get to lane quicker, or to a fight to position. that's it. she doesn't have the greatest range to where her passive can stay up for long. your passive disappears for the most part in any sort of fight, unless you ult then try to go into the fight and not get any sort of focus, and minions also take out her passive. Pretty useless if you ask me. Vayne has something similar to mf's passive. Vayne gets that when running to a enemy champ which is WAY more useful and more dependable. MF's passive is garbage and VERY situational to where unless your team knows what exactly they are doing positioning wise it offers nothing to team fights. it's not a good passive period. 

Needs to be adjusted considerably. 

Her q is pretty decent, although idk why ap ratios are on there.....  she's supposed to be AD last time i checked. but this ability also falls off, you're not going to stop using AA's and ur w to get a q off....

Her w is pretty good and is a nice steroid. i don't have much problems with this ability

Her e is pretty garbage for the most part. can't really use it in lane for the most part, costs so much mana for a little slow? not very useful in all stages of the game... I just don't like this ability and so do most MF players. it's not worth using. 

And for her ult, i read somewhere on the forums before where her ult actually is stupid to use later on in the game as it does little to no dmg. I don't hate her ult though, it's nice to look at. 

okay she runs an exact 51% winrate with a little over 5% popularity.......... that isn't really good. she's not a popular adc for quite a few reasons, and mainly it comes down to her kit is somewhat clunky and doesn't quite gel together. at least with the constraints that it has on at the moment. 

Overall, she needs a VU, needs her passive to be adjusted. and her E should be looked at again or changed entirely.

Thank you for giving a good argument, rather than people just saying something like "LOL MF SO BAD RITO BUFF PLS GG PASSIVE SUCKS".

Her Q does fall off late game, but it also has doubled the AD Scaling by the way. 

Her E is so useful, you can use it to check brushes, follow up on CC, get away from chasing enemies, help push lane, and I've even used it to execute someone after I've died. It has more uses than that like zoning them off and other tricks but it's very versatile. They are however changing/buffing or whatever to it, they just said they're doing something with her E soon.

And her ultimate has a base damage of 1,000 + Grevious Wounds + 2 stacks of her W passive. Just yesterday a Miss Fortune followed up on a Leona stun I believe and ended up doing 1350 damage with her ultimate alone.

She's getting a small visual update, but yeah I agree her passive could use a small buff or change and her E is also being currently looked at. She's still a great ADC with incredibly scary high damage output if you leave her unchecked.

> [{quoted}](name=ILoveTyranny,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AjE0Bc6z,comment-id=000b0000000100000000,timestamp=2015-06-14T16:37:04.401+0000)

Thank goodness she's getting looked at. Her passive and E is the main 2 things I'm concerned about.

I used to worry about her ultimate but I actually never looked at the numbers, I was so stunned after I played {{champion:21}} again and noticed "omg there's no ad ratio?!?! when I played her before she did!!!". I didn't really notice any early-mid game changes with her damage but late game I could tell she falls off with her ultimate damage and sometimes even her abilities. 

I love her Q so much though... I find it so useful in lane and even to bounce off to a support running away with their ADC on low health. then I Q him, then POP! There goes the ADC. 

Hopefully they do change the passive to something like {{champion:86}}'s though. Having it ONLY cancel by 11+ level neutral monsters or any enemy champion damage. :)

> [{quoted}](name=AsheGetsGanked,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AjE0Bc6z,comment-id=000b0000,timestamp=2015-06-14T04:00:07.532+0000)

> She needs more than a small buff. First, she needs a VU. Then her E needs to be looked at again, it's a pretty useless skin esp with mana costs. Her passive also is garbage for an adc. Her ult isn't that good. Q and W are okay skills. that's more than a small buff, she needs a minor rework imo.

She was fine before the mini rework.The fact that she needs another one shows how rushed the previous one was.

> [{quoted}](name=turulHAARP,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AjE0Bc6z,comment-id=000b00000000,timestamp=2015-06-14T12:45:24.937+0000)
>
> She was fine before the mini rework.The fact that she needs another one shows how rushed the previous one was.

I feel she gets outclassed honestly. esp since you can't really use your E for most of the game, as well as your ult falls off pretty quickly. plus a shitty passive.............

> [{quoted}](name=AsheGetsGanked,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AjE0Bc6z,comment-id=000b000000000000,timestamp=2015-06-14T15:28:40.023+0000)
>
> I feel she gets outclassed honestly. esp since you can't really use your E for most of the game, as well as your ult falls off pretty quickly. plus a shitty passive.............

She was THE lane bully before.She was like tristana with relatively long cooldowns but the spells had big impact when were used well especially her ulti.She could have been at that time the counterpick to lucian,corki,sivir trifecta but somebody thought it would be a good idea to change her.Now she has been modernized and lost her niche.
The targeting system on the new Q simply sucks.The damage on her new ulti sucks.
I tried to play her as an AD caster thanks to the low cd on Q but guess what.With enough attack speed casting Q actually lowers DPS which is ridiculous.This happens because of the cast time and animation is simply too long.Also the second bounce doesn't apply Spellblade...Her passive was/is kinda fine though i wouldn't mind a new passive.The problem is the rest of her kit.

Miss Fortune was the ADC i chose as the one I wanted to play...
so now i play everything but ADC >.>

> [{quoted}](name=Swampmajikk,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AjE0Bc6z,comment-id=000d,timestamp=2015-06-14T18:59:35.530+0000)
>
> Miss Fortune was the ADC i chose as the one I wanted to play...
> so now i play everything but ADC >.>

Dang. I feel for you. 

Even though mine is sorta the opposite, since {{champion:21}} was the one who inspired me to play ADCs like {{champion:222}} or even {{champion:51}}. 

I still play {{champion:21}}, (_since I pretty much play unranked and customs all the time_), and she's still super fun to play. 

She is also still strong-_ish_ depending on the team comp you have, the enemies', and etc, I just feel like **some** _buffs_ or _tweaks_ should be taken in place. 

You should play her for fun sometimes. :)

> [{quoted}](name=Jinxynaenae,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AjE0Bc6z,comment-id=000d0000,timestamp=2015-06-14T19:05:38.604+0000)

well im also just not very good at the adc role..
i do like caitlyn and jinx and i'd like to play ashe but i find her pretty difficut to be good with.
but MF is the adc that fits my playstyle the best.
I prefer building a gunblade on her instead of bloodthirster because of her weird damage scaling.
a well aimed bullet time can heal her completely and hurt pretty hard.

lol im not a good player obviously because off my level but ive actually started to play normalls with

{{champion:22}} {{champion:21}} and {{champion:51}} and i can tell that miss fortune is the worse out of al of tem

She isn't necessarily the worse. She actually counters Ashe and Caitlyn too. They all however, do have VERY different strengths and weaknesses.

If your team needs stronger teamfighting or just a high damage output ADC, go Miss Fortune. But she needs a frontline so be careful if you do pick her for that role.

If you need more utility and a relatively safe ADC with reliable early, mid, and late games then pick Ashe.

And if you need to bully the enemy bot lane hard to prevent someone like Vayne Kalista or Jinx from getting too fed early on, then go Caitlyn. But her mid game is really, really bad.
Give her autos a chance to randomly proc her q. Or make it proc when she crits or something that would be fun imo.

> [{quoted}](name=Chewbacca Merkin,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AjE0Bc6z,comment-id=0008,timestamp=2015-06-14T01:15:41.830+0000)
>
> Give her autos a chance to randomly proc her q. Or make it proc when she crits or something that would be fun imo.

Inb4 bug makes the q work with hurrican and you just see mf playing ping pong, bullets flying everywhere.
That would be **OP** in some ways but that would be fun as _!@#$_ even if it lasted for a few days on PBE. Lol.

MF needs to deal all physical damage on her ult and her passive needs to not be lost on minion damage.  She was actually really good before her mini rework which made her worse by undoing the fix to make her ult do physical damage.

You know this is actually true... 

I used to play her but I don't anymore.

Yes she has a really good early game but she falls off **sooooo** hard late game dude.

Her passive needs to have minions being noncancelable and her ultimate needs those AD ratios back. Your reasoning with the E having some AD ratios also makes some sense.

She doesn't fall off that hard late game if you know how to play her. Due to her W's passive, her high base damage and fair AD scaling on her ult, and due to her ability to siege/push and fight late game, full build, teamfights just fine (not saying she's a Vayne or Jinx, but she can do it just fine.) she doesn't have a fall off to the point where she's useless. But yeah her early game is strong and after playing her so long, I honestly feel safe to say she's also one of the strongest mid game ADCs if not the strongest. Even in comparison to Sivir, MF's mid game is godlike and I don't see how people say it's a poor one.
If ANY damage removes the speed from mobi boots, any damage should remove the speed from MF's passive. It's basically built in mobi boots.

> [{quoted}](name=chipndip1,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AjE0Bc6z,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2015-06-14T00:21:00.861+0000)
>
> If ANY damage removes the speed from mobi boots, any damage should remove the speed from MF's passive. It's basically built in mobi boots.

Your comparing items to champions actual abilities. 

If anything this just proves how the passive needs to be changed similar to {{champion:86}}'s passive where only 11+ level neutral monsters and any enemy champion damage only cancels her passive. 

That would be fairly acceptable and would actually be very great for any type of passive change done to {{champion:21}}.
She gains a maximum of 70 movement speed. That's literally like having free Swift Boots. Why do we need even more mobility creeping?

> [{quoted}](name=chipndip1,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AjE0Bc6z,comment-id=000600010000,timestamp=2015-06-14T16:24:49.669+0000)
>
> She gains a maximum of 70 movement speed. That's literally like having free Swift Boots. Why do we need even more mobility creeping?

Let's see...

* no escapes unless you count her E which you shouldn't rely on
* no dashes
* no chasing unless you count her E which you shouldn't rely on unless they're close to you 
* logically speaking- the big deal is where minions can cancel it (in other words, we're not asking for increased/decreased movement speed)
* mobility and ~~tankyiness~~ is pretty much the new meta (from what my friends and some other people has told me)
* you can lose so many kills if a minion hits you while chasing
* you can die so many times if a minion hits you while trying to escape

What's the big deal even if she got something like the {{champion:86}}'s passive, which only neutral monsters level 11+ and all enemy champions can cancel it? 

I don't really see anything wrong with if it if you ask me. Just my **opinion**.

{{champion:22}} : No escapes. Ult stun is shorter the closer they are, which is what an escape is for. The slow on her arrows and ult are nerfed from her pre-rework q at higher ranks.

No dash

She can chase with her slows on her shots, which helps with securing kills, I'll give you that.

Obviously dies because she has no escape.

{{champion:222}} : No escapes. Gets a degrading boost of speed if she kills or destroys something, and her chomps are her one shot to shake someone.

No dash

Good range on q, but nothing really "helps" her chase unless someone was killed or a turret was destroyed.

Obviously can lose kills unless she snipes them with her ult, and they even nerfed the initial damage of it so if someone body blocks it early your ult is literally worth less than an auto.

Obviously can die since she has no escape

Both of these champs are strong without relying on a large, semi-permanent speed boost. MF may need buffs, but her movement speed's longevity doesn't need the buff. MF can be made strong by adding value to her actual fighting skills, rather than Strut. Strut already gives her 105 movement with Berserker Greaves. She's literally moving as fast as those with mobi boots, and you want her, the one with the huge killing potential (in comparison to the supports who'll most likely have mobi boots), to be the one that doesn't even lose it when running through minion aggro? That'd be brain dead.

Side note: The difference between {{champion:21}} and {{champion:86}} is that MF's passive is strong on offense and defense, whereas Garen's just gives him health regen. Garen's is much less influential on match logistics than MF.

But having the {{champion:86}} 'bonus' wouldn't really be such a major buff. Really the only problem with Strut is how **one** little minion can cancel it. 

It has a lot of cons just from that _one_ little minion, (_look below_). 

Even if League said yes to change it to something similar to the only 11+ level neutral monsters will cancel and any enemy champion could break it, **_what's the big deal_**? 

It's just to release_ frustration_ and actually sorta aid when **SOME** of those times happen in-lane, (_chasing, escaping, poking, mobility problems, etc_). _Nothing_ too huge to argue about here if they did that. And if it's an actual huge deal for some reason they could always remove the speed a tiny bit, (_10-15_), or even change the passive _completely_.

The big deal is that 105 movement in and of itself is a big deal. That's why "one little minion" can cancel anyone's mobi boots. If the boost was around 20-25 or so, I wouldn't mind, but it's 70. Built in. And it additively stacks with any boots. So even if you lose the 70, unlike those wearing mobi boots, you're still sitting on a lvl 2 boost in speed, which is fair enough as is.

Just buff something else in her kit.

Here's the thing: Movement speed is stronger than you give it credit for. It basically decides if someone lives or dies. Garen's passive is nothing but health regen. Slow, gradual healing. It's not NEARLY as significant as a boost in speed that's stronger than most upgraded boots options without Alacrity enchantments. So with this said...STOP COMPARING THE PASSIVE TO GAREN'S. The significance of mobility is way beyond that of health regen.
No, it is worse than mobility boots. Mobility boots still leave you with level 3 bonus movement speed. Meanwhile, MF passive going down leaves with nothing at all.

No it doesn't give you lvl 3 movement when it's out. It's lvl 1. -_-

It's 25 movement while it's down. 105 when it's up. It's lvl 1 as soon as a caster minion thinks you gotta take 6 damage for looking at it funny.
